duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop risk-based strategies, tools, and techniques for ongoing monitoring and assessment of the Wealth risk and control environment.
Manage and support applications used in the fiduciary regulatory review process.
Gather data, create agendas, monitor attendance, and write minutes for Working Groups and/or Committee meetings.
Conduct risk and control assessments on a regular basis to ensure Segment/LOB/Function meets corporate standards.
Deliver/influence recommendations for the update of Segment/LOB/Function procedures and risk/control documentation.
Establish strong working relationships with 2nd line of defense partners and Enterprise Risk, working on program improvements by providing feedback and LOB perspective.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, or Accounting, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience (Master's preferred)
